content.label:
Well done dev and design team on Battleheart Legacy!  It’s like diablo 3 for your phone but lighter and more cartoonish.  

There’s some design decisions I really appreciate in the game that I hope other RPG makers would take note of. Number 1: there is no monster scaling!  A wolf is a wolf. A green orc archer is a green orc archer.  There’s no monsters that look exactly the same but have an inflated monster level associated with them.  So that makes your character level matter.  There are level numbers labeled on different areas but that’s just to let you know the difficulty.  A level 7 area might have 1 ogre at the end while a level 15 area might jump right into 3 ogres at once but the ogres are the same unless it’s a boss ogre or green ogre .  

The character progression and classes are handled very well and allow for interesting combinations, and the pacing of power increase from leveling is very good — it’s not too extreme like Diablo.  

The equipment is fairly good — simplified which makes sense for a phone game.  Feels like it could be a bit better in terms of adding special equipment or weapons with weird abilities but maybe that’s in the end game — my character is level 20.

Overall, on of the best iPhone games!  And no in app fleecing.  You get the whole game .  I do hope there is a sequel or expansion.

Oh one more criticism.  The melee classes don’t auto attack if you are out of range. You have to move to them and then attack .  So I recommend a ranged or magic character.  Dev, please add an option to have melee characters automatically move to and attack when you click on an enemy. 

Wizard teleport plus necro corpse explosion is really fun btw.  You can mix different classes skills do make your own combos.

title.label: Hands down, my favorite iOS game.

content.label: Hands down, my favorite iOS game. I would not hesitate to buy a part 2 or update. BHL has the perfect balance of RPG elements and playability. I have played and replayed this game so many times, building and experimenting with character builds. I love it. Just wish I could find something even close to compare.

title.label: What I was looking for in a mobile RPG

content.label:
Another review mentioned KOTOR and Fable 1 in their comparison of this game. That alone got me to buy it and play it. I’d like to add that there is also a fair comparison to Final fantasy tactics, in terms of classes and jobs and how to mix them.

This is a great game. It has character development depth, but not overly complicated,  like Baldur’s Gate for mobile for example. It’s a good mix between casual and in-depth. You can pick this game up in minutes, but spend weeks playing and replaying it with different character builds.
Definitely worth trying.
Great game

This game is fantastic for the ppl who enjoy dungeons crawlers on pc or consoles. When they announced braveheart 2 I was excited but when I found out it wasn’t a rpg like this I was very sad. I’m still hoping they make a newer version of this game! I would be sure to buy it if they do!

This game has tons of replay value and a solid framework.   This game is one of the only mobile games that I will be eagerly looking forward to play the sequel to.   I’d love to see this taken and expanded upon with more of everything in the next rendition - more gear options, more skills and progression options, more dungeon, and more hilarious dialogue options!

title.label: Best phone game I’ve ever played.

content.label: MIKA MOBILE GIVE US MORE. I sunk literal DAYS worth of my time into this game.

This game is a great RPG with amazing gameplay. I downloaded this app because I needed games to play and I had the first one and liked it. This game blew my expectations out of the water and easily became my favorite game. I now have over 300+ hours and completed the game multiple times with most classes and is still fun to play. Now that being said this game takes a while to get good but climbing the ladder to victory was an enjoyable experience. I only found one bug in my years playing it. You can teleport in some rocks with the wizard’s active teleport  or the ninja’s passive teleport, but is very easy to avoid as long as you don’t tap on the rocks.(which is very easy not to do) This game is incredibly smooth with reliable data saves. If you are looking at getting an RPG on your phone I very much advise that you get this game. Well worth the money.

title.label: Great game, needs more mini quests though

content.label: Great game, but after your level 20 all you can do is grind :/

This is a great game, but people keep comparing it to Battleheart 2, and that is not a sequel to this game. I don’t see why the support for this game has to end because so many people, including me, really like this game. You can’t please everyone, some people will never like B2, so there is no reason why this game can’t keep being updated for all of us fans. Someone suggested a sequel to Battleheart Legacy, and I completely agree.
Really awesome game. Kind of wish you will have expansions for it so we can keep playing it.

title.label: I love this game to bits

content.label:
Ever since I found this game I instantly fell in love with it. Well how could I not it incorporates everything I love about an rpg: the endless possibilities of skill sets, the variety of classes in which you unlock through playing the game and the hours of grinding being put in to make your hero stronger.
Mika Mobile if you are reading this then please make a sequel to this game as well, heck even a big update would satisfy me greatly as well.
Awesome RPG. Never gets old playing this classic RPG.

Amazing game I never was able to beat. Quite long and with the amount of games on the AppStore I never got around to finishing it. A year later I played for about an hour and remembered how great this game was. Unfortunately, I couldn’t enjoy it too much as it’s not optimized for iPhone X. Please devs, update this gem. More so now that BH2 is out.

I never ended up getting any quests (not sure why, I checked back multiple times), the fights get repetitive, and the final boss battle is a lot more difficult (x 10) than anything else in the game. I finally threw in the towel. I suspect it would be better the 2nd time through with a clear strategy of building a character for the final battle.

This game has more replay ability than some sixty dollar titles out there. Years later I can hop back on and make a new build and take different paths to make a very fun and entertaining experience for a second time. The dialogue can be witty and well done, and the gameplay is fluid and smooth. Its art style isn’t as charming as the original Battleheart, yet it still manages to be a vibrant interpretation that’s altered slightly from the four-partied original. The beginning and ending are very well done and are enticing and interesting, but the middle game (12-25) tends to be very lackluster. Every good RPG has a good grind, but sometimes it can feel too grind-y. I’m personally very excited for Battleheart 2 and hope they make the game feel amazing through the entire experience! Thanks MikaMobile for your fabulous IOS game that will be one of my all time favorites.

Battleheart Legacy is an incredibly fun RPG that brings you back to old school games like the Final Fantasy series. However, the one problem with this game is that there aren’t very many NPC related storylines, for example, if you try to learn the Ninja class, you eventually get in a fight with the knights. After this you say that you can help the Ninjas bye getting the guards off their back. However this never progresses. In the game you are also able to join the Cartel at multiple points, but it never develops. This is a very fun game and I think these types of stories would make it even better

This game is my favorite on the AppStore. I played the original and now this one plays on that experience to create one of if not the best App Store games ever. My only issue is that they have not launched another game like it.
Can you guys update this game to where the screen itself can fit the iPhone 10’s screen. Thank you

If you kill the guy that gives you the quest to raid a caravan that happens to belong to the cartel and then go and try to raid the caravan then when you get there enter into dialog with one of the knights and reply with sure ill help the game crashes please fix pronto because i promise i will find more

title.label: My favorite game in the App Store!

content.label: Battleheart legacy is by far my favorite game in the App Store! Could be yours too! With loads of character classes to choose from, leveling up is addicting. If you’re a fan of the elder scrolls series, chances are you’ll love this game. It’s got a free roaming, open-world feel, with plenty of quests to undertake. The graphics are appealing and the combat system is fun. If you’re looking for a good rpg to take on the road with you, I’d recommend battleheart legacy!

title.label: Fun Diablo like game for one player on a phone

content.label: I liked Battleheart, but this is even better. Fun combat and skill development, and nice story elements.

This is probably the best mobile game I’ve ever seen it is not pay to win really addictive (so don't play if your very busy) I spent an hour playing this game and i just got it also not very laborious grinding definitely worth the price
I purchased this game based on the positive reviews and recommendations.  However I’ve been unable to here any game sound.  Disappointing for a game this mature.

my wife got me this game years and years ago and I neglected it after a while mainly because I was neglecting my wife ha ha. But I have picked it back up again and after level six or so it all starts to come together.  I have a barbarian who squirts out a smoke cloud when ranged gets tough for him. I love him so. We are considering getting married but not really because he is just pixels and I am heterosexual.

title.label: Very Clunky Controls and Slow Gameplay

content.label:
I don’t think I have the patience to play this. I’m not gonna ask for a refund. I’m sure it’s as great as everyone says but the control is a real problem. I’ve already played the tutorial but already I have problems.

1. Character moves WAY too slow. This will get very annoy very fast.

2. The game forces you to get near someone to talk to them. I understand why it’s this way for combat. But tapping on a friendly should allow me to talk them no matter how close or far my character and the NPC are from each other. At the very least auto-walk my character to that NPC. Have to tap near that NPC to move my character near them is wearing thin on my patience. And some NPCs move around! Even when you walk into a single room are (like a house) you’re forced to do this!

3. You’re forced to tap the (X) to close dialog boxes. This is annoying for 2 reasons.
- I keep trying to tap ANYWHERE OUTSIDE the dialog box to end a chat. Just like all other games let you do.
- Playing the on a tablet, it’s more comfortable to have my hands on the left and right of the screen. And it’s annoying to keep moving my hands off the side to tap the bottom-middle. Maybe give players a choice to use the left or right side for more comfort. I get that it makes sense to place it on the bottom if I was playing this on a phone but I’m on a big tablet!

4. Why can’t I double tap on a spot to move? I know you can hold the button down but again other games don’t make you do this!

Listen, I bought this game because it got a lot of high praise and it lets you play offline. But this issues are getting in the way of me enjoying it. I’m sure I’m in the minority but if it matters to you I think working out these quality of life issues would make for a better game.

Thank you.
Such a good game! Should have some updates with new things.

title.label: One of the many most enjoyable mobile games I own.

content.label:
I own 50+ games for my iPad, and this is the best in its category. It’s a unbelievably fun action RPG. The action is great, it’s complex enough for die hard RPG fans, but it’s not so complex that if you put the game down for a few weeks you’ll have to start over. The humor is spot on, and the animations are great. I’ve been playing as a mage, but am just as excited to play the game again as a different class. Plus NO in game advertising or sales that I’ve seen. Want a game you can spend en a tire weekend in front of, or pick up when you have 5 or 10 minutes that always fun, this is it. 
 
The follow in for the developers and not a criticism of the game. In a new release, I would offer mini maps for individual missions/battles, some more enemy info, and the ability to undo purchases ( I’ve double clicked by accident more than once) This is one of the most fun games I’ve ever played.

I really enjoy this game as it is far more thorough than any other game on the app store but the developer has kind off abandoned the game and many people are hoping for a multiplayer feature to be added
The gameplay is great, and the grind for cool loot is there, but multiple times the game has crashed mainly on the Colusseum and certain missions. All progress lost. No XP gained. One star.

Months later and I would have hoped this wonderful game would support the latest flagship. It’s possible a update may never come. Apps stop getting support all the time. Or maybe at some point it will come.
this is a perfect game, please add more weapon armor and avatar thanks!

title.label: 5 stars worth the money tons of playtime

content.label: this game is the first in a long time that is actually worth the money. this game has lots of items upgrades spells powers it has everything. I only wish there were some more quests towards the end but its great and sometimes very funny 5 stars

Battleheart Legacy is one of the best games in the App Store. It’s unfortunate the top is taken up by such poorly designed, toss-away, ‘addicting’ games, for the Battlehearts are well designed and truly deserving of the top. This game is one I come back to again and again over the years, and with every play-through, I hold the same enjoyment experienced the first time. Thank you.

(P.S. Necromancy is the best path!)
This is a classic RPG with fun graphics, easy controls and, challenging battles. Best of all, NO IN-APP PURCHASES! I love it!

I don’t normally rate apps but felt this one deserved it.  The game is well balanced, challenging, creative, and the class system gives an impressive amount of freedom for customization.  The storyline is simple and funny and good enough. The mechanics are well developed but different: this game doesn’t feels like it copies anything.  I particularly liked the fact that it dispenses with a crafting system, which I find tiresome in modern rpgs.

My only complaint is that the depth and variability of the story and available quests is quite limited and limits replayability significantly, even when you switch classes.  I won the game once and really enjoyed the whole experience.  Now I am in the middle of replaying a second time with an entirely different class but still find myself getting bored.  

That is not, in my view, a sufficient reason to give less than five stars. But if the developers are listening, try playing the avernum games. Mix that broad and wide experience with this approach and you’d have something really unmatched. (I realized I just revealed my advanced age...)

there seems to be a lot of content. i like battleheart but i found controlling multiple characters a bit cumbersome. in battleheart legacy you can build one at a time and focus more on little stories and silly dialogue between the dungeons, in which the mechanics are quite improved from battleheart i think! excited to see all this game has to offer.

after playing everyday a while:

i will never tire of this! i have quit my other games. battleheart legacy forever! my current character is a wizard who studies craft on the side. also have a knight-paladin who is a really mean and stupid person. i could go on: just play this game!
This was a rather enjoyable game and I do recommend it, however I must warn you that there are a lot of side quests that were never finished.
Amazing game!!! Please make a another!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Overall a good game. Worth a try if you love rpg. The only reason I do not score 5 is that this game crashes every time I am killing the boss which is really annoying.

I love this game one of the best RPGs I have ever played but here are are some things you could maybe add. You can add boats for the pond on the map. Pet shops where you could buy visible pets that you could buy skills for. Mount shop for traveling faster. And last but not least a new map for levels 30 and above. Also add multiplayer like as in joining worlds from the same wifi multiplayer. And yeah that's pretty much it. If you could add theses in future updates that would be great!

Graphics: 5/5
Music: 3/5
Fun: 3.5/5
Dialogue: 5/5
Controls: 5/5
Replayable: 4/5

I give it 4 of 5 stars because the fun factor wasn’t high enough. Graphics were awesome. They should warn you that all your in-game decisions are irreversible. 

I DO recommend buying this game. 
Might play it again.

I almost never write reviews on App Store games but I felt I needed to write one for Battleheart Legacy. The controls are superb and the flexible class system makes the replay value very high. Random encounters add to the replay value (like the one where you find a battle mage and then can become that class). Overall 10/10 game.
This is a good game.  Issues with the game not saving. One star off for that.  Need to be able to save the game.

title.label: Great game!! Add virtual stick please

content.label: The controls are smooth, the scripts are funny, I enjoy the game altogether. Great quality. I just ask that they add a virtual stick to play with

I downloaded this immediately because I loved Battleheart. It was a great game until I realized that the last two bosses are nearly impossible to beat, even when 20 levels above the recommended level. Pretty disappointing. Also a lot of hints at side stories that never actually materialized.

Jeez I just played 1 hour and 48 mins of this game from 100% on my phone now it's on 61, crazy that's amazing... this game I wasnt sure about then I bought it and literally it was so fun and addictive! Buy it I absolutely thought Rpg's were boring until I played this game...

Fed-up with freemium? Today's game market it saturated with "freemium" games. "Play for free until level 1..." This game is such a break from all that freemium B.S. Quality, game through and through!  Game interface is wonderful, storyline never disappoints. Pay a few bucks for this game. You won't be let down.
You get what you pay for and don't have to pay a dollar xtra. Very fun. Very polished. Runs great. 5 stars

After looking for a good RPG on iPhone, I played Bastion, wayward souls, and countless others while those are all very good games I held off on buying this one mainly due to the art style. However after getting this game I was very impressed at how great of a game it is. It is very deep and don't mind the other reviews about the sectioned off areas it's not that big of a deal. The environmental quality is impressive with the foliage, caves, deserts, etc. If you're on the fence or looking for something you will be playing for a long time get this game.
